1.title: Peanuts
1.author: [No author]
1.series: 1950) "Raw Peanuts" p. 118-123 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 4
notes: A collection of Peanuts strips from 1950 that were never reprinted in book form.

2.title: Peanuts
2.author: by Charles M
2.series: May 16, 1954) "Lucille Van Pelt on the First Tee, Please"
notes: Summary: Lucy has entered a golf tournament, and worries about playing against Sam Snead, Ben Hogan, and Ike. Charlie Brown reminds her that it's a women's tournament.

This Sunday strip is reproduced as part of a letter to the editor, as evidence that grownups (here only from the shoulders down) sometimes appeared in Peanuts. p. 14 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).

3.title: Peanuts
3.author: by Charles M
3.series: May 23, 1954) "There's Nothing That Can Stop You Now, Lucy!"*
notes: Summary: Lucy starts her round at the women's state amateur tournament with an eagle and a birdie.

This Sunday strip is reproduced as part of a letter to the editor, as evidence that grownups (here only from the shoulders down) sometimes appeared in Peanuts. p. 14 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).

4.title: Peanuts
4.author: by Charles M
4.series: May 30, 1954) "I'm Supposed to be Home Taking a Nap!"*
notes: Summary: Lucy is one hole from winning the tournament, when she suddenly leaves the golf course.

This Sunday strip is reproduced as part of a letter to the editor, as evidence that grownups (here in full figure, but in the far distance or with blank faces) sometimes appeared in Peanuts. p. 14 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9 (=v. 3, no. 1) (Summer 2001).

5.title: Peanuts
5.author: [No author]
5.series: Aug. 1957) "Swipe File" p. 8 in The Comics Journal, no. 215
notes: Shows Schulz' Peanuts (Aug. 1957) and Basset's Adam (June 27, 1999), both Sunday strips about kites.

6.title: Peanuts
6.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus stops the rain as if by magic, and worries that people will think he's a demon.
Original copyright 1960.

7.title: Peanuts
7.author: by Schulz
7.appears_in: p. 15 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 21, no. 15 (Mar. 24, 1966).
notes: A panel advertising Easter Seals.

8.title: Peanuts
8.author: Schulz.
8.series: Sept. 19, 1966) "My Books! My Records! My Pool Table! My Van Gogh!"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown smells smoke, and Snoopy's house is on fire.

9.title: Peanuts
9.author: Schulz.
9.series: Feb. 10, 1967) "Creo que es una Pierna Delantera"*
notes: Summary: Lucy doesn't want to break the Masked Marvel's arm.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 10, 1967 translated into Spanish.

10.title: Peanuts
10.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: All the mail is for Snoopy.
Peanuts Sunday strip from Feb. 12, 1967, converted to a daily and translated into Spanish.
The original strip was about valentines.

11.title: Peanuts
11.author: Schulz.
11.series: Feb. 13, 1967) "Es Lucy Contra la Maravilla Enmascarada"*
notes: Summary: Lucy and Snoopy have been arm wrestling for two hours.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 13, 1967 translated into Spanish.

12.title: Peanuts
12.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Just as both Lucy and Snoopy are at the end of their strength, Snoopy kisses Lucy on the nose.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 14, 1967 translated into Spanish.

13.title: Peanuts
13.author: Schulz.
13.series: Feb. 15, 1967) "Me Besó con sus Estúpidos Labios de Perro!"*
notes: Summary: Lucy says Snoopy's kiss was an unfair way to win the arm wrestling championship.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 15, 1967 translated into Spanish.

14.title: Peanuts
14.author: Schulz.
14.series: Feb. 17, 1967) "En Cuanto le Muestre lo que Hice, Me Hará una Toma de Judo"*
notes: Summary: Sally broke the crayon she took, and she's afraid of her teacher's reaction.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 17, 1967 translated into Spanish.

15.title: Peanuts
15.author: Schulz.
15.series: Feb. 17, 1967) "No me Interesa tu Moralidad de Clase Media"*
notes: Summary: Sally's lied to her teacher, so what?
Peanuts strip from Feb. 17, 1967, translated into Spanish.

16.title: Peanuts
16.author: Schulz.
16.series: Feb. 18, 1967) "Qué Haces con una Hermana Menor que Miente?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown asks Dr. Lucy what to do about Sally's lie about the crayon.
Peanuts strip from Feb. 18, 1967, translated into Spanish.

17.title: Peanuts
17.author: di Schulz
17.appears_in: p. 12 in European Newspaper Comic Strips : a survey of 79 strips collected from various European papers dated August 16 to September 10, 1968 (collection assembled in the Michigan State University Comic Art Collection). This strip taken from Paese Sera (Rome) (Aug. 19, 1968).
notes: Strip dated July 24, 1967. Peanuts in Italian.

18.title: Peanuts
18.author: Schulz.
18.series: July 14, 1969) "I'm the World's Best Lawn Sprinkler Runner-Througher!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is disappointed that Lucy won't let him join the fun.
Original copyright 1969.

19.title: Peanuts
19.author: Schulz.
19.series: Apr. 9, 1970) "Where Are All The Girls Who Play Outfield?"*
notes: Summary: The world is changing: the girls are "new feminists" and won't play baseball.

20.title: Peanuts
20.author: Schulz.
20.series: Apr. 10, 1970) "But You Still Don't Want to Play Center Field?"*
notes: Summary: Lucy says the new feminists are going to change the world.

21.title: Peanuts
21.author: Schulz.
21.series: June 30, 1970) "I Don't Recall Asking for Any Advice, Sweetie!"*
notes: Summary: Lucy suggests that Snoopy's speech should be about "the new women's liberation movement."

22.title: Peanuts
22.author: Schulz.
22.series: Dec. 12, 1971) "This Morning We'll Work On Our Dutch Waltz"*
notes: Summary: Lucy is giving Snoopy a lesson: "We start in the Kilian position..."

23.title: Peanuts
23.author: by Schulz.
23.series: Oct. 14, 1972) "I Think I Should Open with an Impassioned Plea Against the Stamp Act"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty (Patricia Reichardt) is reporting to the student council, and has brought her attorney Snoopy along for advice.

24.title: Peanuts
24.author: Schulz.
24.series: Sept. 9, 1976) "This Year I Plan to Get Nothing but Straight A's!"*
notes: Summary: Sally says she'd accept a few bent ones.

25.title: Peanuts
25.author: Schulz.
25.series: Oct. 17, 1977) "It's Like Giving a Starving Man a Menu"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty has trouble with multiple choice tests.

26.title: Peanuts
26.author: by Charles M
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tells Snoopy that supper isn't ready, they've been having a few problems.

27.title: Peanuts
27.author: Schulz.
27.series: Nov. 21, 1977) "The Polar Bears are in Trouble Today"
notes: Summary: Woodstock has gone hunting with a spear.

28.title: Peanuts
28.author: Schulz.
28.series: June 5, 1981) "I Got My Finger Caught in My Binder!"*
notes: Summary: Patty has tears in her eyes on the last day of school, but she's not being sentimental.

29.title: Peanuts
29.author: Schulz.
29.series: June 16, 1981) "I Need That Golf Ball More Than You Do"*
notes: Summary: Patty says she's going to be a famous golfer, and takes the ball from Lucy.

30.title: Peanuts
30.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty practices sand shots in the sandbox.

31.title: Peanuts
31.author: by Schulz.
31.series: Aug. 11, 1982) "I Have to Bounce a Golf Ball Against the Steps"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown doesn't have a place to play baseball.

32.title: Peanuts
32.author: Schulz.
32.series: Oct. 14, 1982) "I Suppose it would be Impolite to Ask for a Second Opinion"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown brings Snoopy his supper, saying it's probably the finest dog dinner in history.

33.title: Peanuts
33.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy's bowling average is one, so his handicap is 179.

34.title: Peanuts
34.author: Schulz.
34.series: May 5, 1983) "I Guess I'm One of the Lucky Ones"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has a surprise for Snoopy; he brings supper from a different direction. Snoopy rolls his eyes.

35.title: Peanuts
35.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: To check the wind, Snoopy throws some loose grass in the air before he takes his golf shot, and the grass all lands on Woodstock.

36.title: Peanuts
36.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Lucy can't understand how Snoopy can eat that stuff.

37.title: Peanuts
37.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown compliments Snoopy on his putt, and Snoopy explains.

38.title: Peanuts
38.author: by Schulz.
38.series: May 4, 1984) "I See Your Face in Every ... Crab Grass"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy has to re-think the letter he's writing to his sweetheart.

39.title: Peanuts
39.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown brings Snoopy a menu to order from.

40.title: Peanuts
40.author: Schulz
40.appears_in: reproduced on p. 137 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Snoopy plays in any charity tournament for a disease he might get.

41.title: Peanuts
41.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Sitting in a shopping cart, Snoopy learns the tournament rules.

42.title: Peanuts
42.author: Schulz.
42.series: Aug. 10, 1984) "Tournament Golf Can Be Very Nerve-Wracking"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy's shaking all over, and hasn't made it to the first tee.

43.title: Peanuts
43.author: Schulz.
43.series: Nov. 14, 1984) "You're Getting Dog Hair All Over the Seat"*
notes: Summary: Spike has a fantasy about the girl in the red pickup and what might happen if she gave him a ride.

44.title: Peanuts
44.author: Schulz.
44.series: May 27, 1985) "In the Game of Life, Grampa has a String of Double Bogeys"*
notes: Summary: Grampa got in trouble at the golf course. His handicap is fifteen, so he parked at the sign that said "handicap parking."

45.title: Peanuts
45.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Rerun's mom is looking for him.

46.title: Peanuts
46.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Rerun's mom has a 10-speed bicycle.

47.title: Peanuts
47.author: Schulz.
47.series: Feb. 12, 1986) "It's Either the Flu or Love"*
notes: Summary: The World War I flying ace's nose is warm, and 65,000 soldiers at Camp Pontanezen, France, have influenza.
Key words: Epidemics, symptoms, fevers.

48.title: Peanuts
48.author: by Charles Schulz.
48.series: Feb. 13, 1986) "Unless I Could Get A Note from My Mother"*
notes: Summary: Duty calls! The World War I flying ace carries on even though he has the influenza.

49.title: Peanuts
49.author: by Charles Schulz.
49.series: Feb. 14, 1986) "How About A Bowl of Dog Food Soup?"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is in bed, the news from the front is bad, everyone has the flu, and he needs to eat something to keep up his strength.

50.title: Peanuts
50.author: Schulz.
50.series: Feb. 17, 1986) "A Get Well Card from the Red Baron!"*
notes: Summary: The World War I flying ace has the flu of 1918, and the French waitress takes care of him and brings him mail.
Key words: Confinement to bed.

51.title: Peanuts
51.author: Schulz.
51.series: Feb. 19, 1986) "When My Grandchildren Ask Me What I Did In The War"*
notes: Summary: President Wilson announces the armistice, WWI is over, and Snoopy still has the flu.
Key words: News, newspapers.

52.title: Peanuts
52.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Marcie is out of school after taking care of the World War I flying ace down with the flu.
Key word: Excuses.

53.title: Peanuts
53.author: by Schulz.
53.series: Feb. 21, 1986) "The World War I Flying Ace Doesn't Give Interviews"*
notes: Summary: The origins of the 1918 flu epidemic are unknown; twenty million people died, and Snoopy was there.

54.title: Peanuts
54.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Rerun has a helmet, with the words "baby on bike" written on it.

55.title: Peanuts
55.author: Schulz.
55.series: July 21, 1986) "Hi! Are You the Dumb One?"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty meets her new tutor.

56.title: Peanuts
56.author: by Charles Schulz.
56.series: Oct. 27, 1986) "I Have an Educated Slice, but it Only Went to the Third Grade"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy isn't happy with his golf stroke.

57.title: Peanuts
57.author: Schulz.
57.series: Mar. 10, 1987) "In the First Film of Beau Geste, Who Played the Role of Boldini?"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy and his fellow foreign legionnaires play trivia.

58.title: Peanuts
58.author: by Schulz.
58.series: Mar. 11, 1987) "The Golf Pro Says for you to Stop Marching Through All the Sand Traps"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has to relay a complaint to Snoopy in his foreign legion outfit.

59.title: Peanuts
59.author: Charles M
59.series: June 11, 1987) "I Love To Hear an Editor Beg"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy gets a rejection letter asking him not to send more stories.
Reprinted in in The Comics Journal, no. 184 (Feb. 1996), p. 5, with an almost identical Peanuts strip dated Jan. 20, 1996.

60.title: Peanuts
60.author: by Schulz.
60.series: Oct. 2, 1987) "Tell the Neighborhood How Much I Eat"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown shouts for the door to be opened for a fifty pound bag of dog food.

61.title: Peanuts
61.author: Schulz.
61.series: Nov. 19, 1987) "It's Hard to Talk to Someone Who Keeps Fainting All the Time"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tries to explain to Snoopy that he's going to have knee surgery and be on crutches.

63.title: Peanuts
63.author: Schulz
63.series: May 16, 1988) "He Could Have Played on the Senior Tour"*
63.appears_in: reproduced on p. 130 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown reads that Noah lived to be 950 years old, and Snoopy reacts.

64.title: Peanuts
64.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Everybody blames lawyers, who in turn blame doctors, but who does the doctor blame?

65.title: Peanuts
65.author: by Charles Schulz.
65.series: Nov. 6, 1988) "You Were There, Too, Weren't You?"*
notes: Summary: Spike went into Needles and had too much root beer, and arrives home with a lampshade on his head. He's telling the cactus, then notices the cactus has a lampshade as well.

66.title: Peanuts
66.author: Schulz.
66.series: Jan. 16, 1989) "Ugly Olaf, That's What They Used to Call Him"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown and Lucy are looking at a photo album of puppies, and they spot Snoopy and Spike but don't recognize Olaf.

67.title: Peanuts
67.author: Schulz.
67.series: Jan. 31, 1989) "Just Like My Life : I'm in the Slow Movement"*
notes: Summary: Marcy and Patty are at the symphony.

68.title: Peanuts
68.author: Schulz.
68.series: Feb. 4, 1989) "A Three-Wood, a Four-Iron, and a Rake!"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown wonders what it'll take to get out of the trap and onto the green.

69.title: Peanuts
69.author: [No author]
69.series: Feb. 14, 1989) "I Could Just Pick Out the Caramels"*
notes: Copyright 1989.
Summary: Snoopy doesn't get the candy because "chocolate isn't good for dogs."

70.title: Peanuts
70.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown greets Snoopy, and the flying ace doesn't appreciate it.

71.title: Peanuts
71.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy and Woodstock are canoeing in the birdbath.

72.title: Peanuts
72.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: A 'perfect grandparent' is somebody who's made a hole in one.

73.title: Peanuts
73.author: Schulz.
73.series: Sept. 20, 1989) "While I Was Waiting, Sir, I Thought I'd Practice A Few Passes"*
notes: Summary: Marcy and Patty are working on their football skills.

74.title: Peanuts
74.author: Schulz.
74.series: Nov. 14, 1989) "The Water Can Either Be Put In First, or Added Last"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is writing cooking hints for mixing dog food in a bowl.

75.title: Peanuts
75.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy hits a powerful drive; Charlie Brown is his caddie.

76.title: Peanuts
76.author: Schulz.
76.series: Mar. 16, 1990) "He Says the Course is Too Narrow"
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown's grandpa plays golf mostly in his head

77.title: Peanuts
77.author: Schulz.
77.series: Apr. 26, 1990) "He Sold Me a New Golf Bag"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown hears that the pro had a suggestion for improving Snoopy's game.

78.title: Peanuts
78.author: by Schulz.
78.series: July 27, 1990) "Maybe I'll Just Jump Into the Lake Right Here"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tries to tell Peggy Jean his name.

79.title: Peanuts
79.author: Schulz.
79.series: Aug. 7, 1990) "Golf is a Cruel Game, Charlie Brown"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has lost Peggy Jean, and Linus says the only thing he can think of to comfort him.

80.title: Peanuts
80.author: Schulz.
80.series: Nov. 22, 1990) "I Dare You to Lick It Off"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown brings Snoopy his Thanksgiving supper; he used his finger to draw a turkey in the dog food.

81.title: Peanuts
81.author: Schulz.
81.series: Nov. 26, 1990) "How Come They Never Have a Catleg?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown says the next hole is par four, dogleg to the right.

82.title: Peanuts
82.author: Schulz.
82.series: Jan. 17, 1991) "Look Out for the Heavy Ones"*
notes: Summary: Woodstock gets bonked by a snowflake as he and Snoopy try to catch them on their tongues.

83.title: Peanuts
83.author: Schulz.
83.series: Jan. 18, 1991) "Stop Taking All the Good Ones"*
notes: Summary: Lucy and Snoopy are catching snowflakes on their tongues.

84.title: Peanuts
84.author: Schulz.
84.series: Feb. 6, 1991) "Forget It. The Roses are All Out of Bounds"*
notes: Summary: On the golf course, Charlie Brown tells Snoopy that Walter Hagen says to stop and smell the roses.

85.title: Peanuts
85.author: by Schulz
85.series: Apr. 21, 1991) "I Think You Have to Relax, and Pretend the Water Isn't There"*
85.appears_in: reproduced on p. 173 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The water hazard looks like a tidal wave.

86.title: Peanuts
86.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy has lost a golf match to a girl sandbagger.

87.title: Peanuts
87.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown asks Snoopy what kid of dog dish he wants.

88.title: Peanuts
88.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown compliments Snoopy on his drive, that's still rolling.

89.title: Peanuts
89.author: Schulz.
89.series: Oct. 7, 1991) "It's the Only Way I Can Find My Way Back to the Clubhouse"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy leaves a trail of golf clubs.

90.title: Peanuts
90.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Spike shows the prize, his new lawnmower, sitting in the sand among the cactus plants.
Original copyright 1991.

91.title: Peanuts
91.author: by Charles Schulz.
91.series: Oct. 16, 1991) "So I Wrote to the Contest People, and Told Them I Had no Use for a Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: So now Spike has a nice toy sailboat in the desert.
Original copyright 1991.

92.title: Peanuts
92.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown starts to read his report on the 1918 flu epidemic, then interrupts it to say that his dog wrote it, and there's Snoopy in front of the class in his World War I flying ace gear.

93.title: Peanuts
93.author: Schulz.
93.series: Nov. 22, 1991) "This is How the Flu Epidemic Began"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown begins to read Snoopy's report on the World War I epidemic to his class: "It was a dark and stormy night."

94.title: Peanuts
94.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Patty presents her report on Edgar Allan Poe.

95.title: Peanuts
95.author: Charles M
95.series: Nov. 28, 1991) "May the Tetherball Wrap Around Your Neck!"*
notes: Summary: Marcy gets her binder tangled in Patty's hair, and then leaves for recess.

96.title: Peanuts
96.author: Charles M
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown reads about someone who had fame and fortune but was never happy, and Snoopy knows the reason why.

97.title: Peanuts
97.author: Schulz.
97.series: Feb. 7, 1992) "Human Beings are Bigger and Smarter and Have More Money So Get Out of the Way!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy bares his teeth, and Lucy stands corrected.

98.title: Peanuts
98.author: by Charles Schulz.
98.series: Feb. 28, 1992) "May I Try This Ball and Paddle Thing, Big Brother?"*
notes: Summary: Sally can't figure out what it does.

99.title: Peanuts
99.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy is lining up a tough putt, and Charlie Brown asks him how much he thinks it breaks.

100.title: Peanuts
100.author: by Charles Schulz.
100.series: Mar. 11, 1992) "Here's the World War I Flying Ace Being Led Off to Prisoner of War Camp"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown leaves Snoopy with Lucy for a few days.

101.title: Peanuts
101.author: by Charles Schulz.
101.series: Apr. 29, 1992) "There's a Lot To Be Said for Snow"*
notes: Summary: They try sliding downhill in a box on grass, and it doesn't go well.

102.title: Peanuts
102.author: Schulz
102.appears_in: reproduced on p. 126 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: As Snoopy takes his shot (Charlie Brown is the caddy), a voice is heard from off-panel. An allusion to Jack Nicklaus.

103.title: Peanuts
103.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy likes golf better the more he plays.

104.title: Peanuts
104.author: Schulz.
104.series: July 31, 1992) "Up Until Then I Was Undecided"*
notes: Summary: Lucy blasts Linus with a garden hose after he says she wouldn't dare.

105.title: Peanuts
105.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is talking to the ball that Snoopy has just hit onto the green.

106.title: Peanuts
106.author: Schulz.
106.series: Sept. 4, 1992) "I've Never Seen a Divot Like This Before"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown holds up an "x" shaped divot, and Snoopy thinks his swing is being criticized.

107.title: Peanuts
107.author: by Charles Schulz.
107.series: Nov. 17, 1992) "Good! We're Out of the Garage!"*
notes: Summary: Rerun is on the bicycle, backseat driving mom past the lawnmower.

108.title: Peanuts
108.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Rerun's mom starts the ride, then turns around because she forgot her car keys, then turns around again because she doesn't need them because she's riding her bicycle.

109.title: Peanuts
109.author: Schulz.
109.series: Nov. 20, 1992) "Every Time I Ride on the Back of My Mom's Bicycle I Age Twenty Years"*
notes: Summary: Rerun told a lady he's 150 years old.

110.title: Peanuts
110.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is trying to explain to the principal, represented by a desk, how Snoopy got all the right answers on a true or false test. Snoopy has his own explanation.

111.title: Peanuts
111.author: by Schulz.
111.series: Jan. 22, 1993) "Do You Mind If I Play Through?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is stuck on the ice on his back like a turtle hoping someone will help him, and Snoopy comes along with his golf clubs.

112.title: Peanuts
112.author: by Schulz.
112.series: Apr. 29, 1993) "And the Prophet Said They Would Beat Their Swords into Golf Clubs"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty doesn't think you could play 18 holes with a plowshare.

113.title: Peanuts
113.author: by Schulz.
113.series: June 11, 1993) "If Our Front Wheel Doesn't Go Down That Grate"*
notes: Summary: Rerun hopes for a good bike ride.

114.title: Peanuts
114.author: Schulz.
114.series: June 16, 1993) "Then They Said Dogs Aren't Allowed on the Course"*
notes: Summary: Spike went into town with his golf clubs and they asked what his handicap was, and he said his handicap was that he's a dog.

115.title: Peanuts
115.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown calls home and Sally laughs at him; he returns sadly to his cot.

116.title: Peanuts
116.author: by Schulz.
116.series: Sept. 30, 1993) "Maybe I'll Ask the Teacher if I Can Move My Desk out Into the Hallway"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has fantasies about sitting next to the Red-Haired Girl.

117.title: Peanuts
117.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy throws his golf club into the water, and it rises to the surface.

118.title: Peanuts
118.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy is at Peppermint Patty's house doing his World War I flying ace act.

119.title: Peanuts
119.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Lucy tells Snoopy that he'll always be a dog.

120.title: Peanuts
120.author: by Charles Schulz.
120.series: May 13, 1994) "What Kind of Advice Could a Pitcher get from an Outfielder?"*
notes: Summary: Lucy offers Charlie Brown some advice.

121.title: Peanuts
121.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy sinks his putt, throws his ball and gets a hail of balls in return.
Silent strip.

122.title: Peanuts
122.author: Schulz.
122.series: July 30, 1994) "If You Don't Mind Someone Staring At You All The Time"*
notes: Summary: Linus wonders about what kind of dog to get, and Charlie Brown says Border Collies are supposed to be good.

123.title: Peanuts
123.author: Schulz.
123.series: Aug. 3, 1994) "When I Told Her You're in the Same Class at School, she Said She Didn't Remember You"*
notes: Summary: And she can't read Charlie Brown's smudgy writing.

124.title: Peanuts
124.author: Schulz.
124.series: Aug. 31, 1994) "If You Were a Border Collie, You'd Be Out Herding Sheep"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy shows how he would herd sheep.

125.title: Peanuts
125.author: by Charles M
125.series: Sept. 1, 1994) "Permission from their Primary Care Physician, and Their Mom"*
notes: Summary: The world famous surgeon explains the rules.
Original copyright 1994.

126.title: Peanuts
126.author: Schulz.
126.series: Sept. 2, 1994) "They Told Me to Get Lost"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy tries herding sheep like a Border Collie.

127.title: Peanuts
127.author: by Charles Schulz.
127.series: Sept. 26, 1994) "A Border Collie can Herd 300 Sheep at a Time"*

128.title: Peanuts
128.author: Schulz.
128.series: Sept. 27, 1994) "She Does Prattle On, Doesn't She"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has a letter from his pen pal Morag, in a Scottish accent.

129.title: Peanuts
129.author: Schulz.
129.series: Sept. 30, 1994) "Ask If She Needs a Good Sheep Dog"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is writing to his pen pal in Glasgow.

130.title: Peanuts
130.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown opens his mailbox hoping for a surprise from Scotland, and Snoopy pops out at him.

131.title: Peanuts
131.author: by Schulz.
131.series: Nov. 14, 1994) "The Secret of Life is to be Older than your Lawn"*
notes: Summary: Franklin's grampa has a profound new philosophy.

132.title: Peanuts
132.author: Schulz.
132.series: Nov. 22, 1994) "Birds Have No Sense of Humor"*
notes: Summary: Woodstock wants a wristwatch for Christmas, and Snoopy thinks that's funny because Woodstock doesn't have any wrists, and Woodstock isn't amused.

133.title: Peanuts
133.author: by Schulz.
133.series: Nov. 29, 1994) "I See There's Still a Light On in the Barracks"*
notes: Summary: The flying ace assumes one of the cooks is still awake.

134.title: Peanuts
134.author: Schulz.
134.series: July 24, 1995) "Stop Singing 'Shall We Gather At The River'"
notes: Summary: Snoopy is golfing near a river, and Woodstock is chirping.

135.title: Peanuts
135.author: Schulz.
135.series: Sept. 21, 1995) "How Are Things in the Trenches?"*
notes: Summary: Spike wants Snoopy to ask General Pershing why the infantry never gets tapioca pudding.

136.title: Peanuts
136.author: Schulz.
136.series: Sept. 22, 1995) "I'd Like Permission to Speak to General Pershing"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy conveys Spike's request for tapioca pudding in the infantry.

137.title: Peanuts
137.author: by Charles Schulz.
137.series: Oct. 31, 1995) "Then I Shall Seek Elsewhere for a Spiritual Cloak to Shield me from my Teacher's Icy Wrath"*
notes: Summary: Sally guilt-trips Charlie Brown into helping her with homework.

138.title: Peanuts
138.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy says you need a Border Collie to herd sheep, because they stare at the sheep.

139.title: Peanuts
139.author: Charles M
139.series: Jan. 20, 1996) "I Love To Hear Them Beg"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy gets a rejection letter asking him not to send more stories.
Reprinted in in The Comics Journal, no. 184 (Feb. 1996), p. 5, with an almost identical Peanuts strip dated June 11, 1987.

140.title: Peanuts
140.author: by Schulz.
140.series: Feb. 16, 1996) "They Ran Out and I Got Bread Pudding!"*
notes: Summary: Spike stood in the chow line in the rain for an hour to get tapioca pudding.

141.title: Peanuts
141.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus wonders whether basketball, hockey, football, or soccer players are the best athletes; Snoopy has another idea.

142.title: Peanuts
142.author: Schulz.
142.series: July 25, 1996) "When Spike Saw His Mom, He Immediately Felt Better"*
notes: Summary: Mom brought tapioca pudding.
Original copyright 1996.

143.title: Peanuts
143.author: by Charles Schulz.
143.series: Apr. 2, 1997) "Did It Bring Tears To Their Eyes?"*
notes: Summary: Linus asks Snoopy about the impassioned speech he gave the jury.

144.title: Peanuts
144.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus wants the teacher to read Alice in Wonderland.

145.title: Peanuts
145.author: by Charles M
notes: Summary: Notes are falling from Schroeder's score, and Snoopy is putting them into a bucket.
Panel without words.

146.title: Peanuts
146.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: The dentist has told Charlie Brown how to avoid cavities.

147.title: Peanuts
147.author: by Charles Schulz.
147.series: July 28, 1997) "Has Anyone Turned In a Cheeseburger?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown goes back to the pro shop to inquire.
Key words: Golf, lost and found, searching, running.

148.title: Peanuts
148.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Rerun kicks the beach ball across the ocean to some other little kid, Lucy comments.

149.title: Peanuts
149.author: by Charles Schulz.
149.series: July 30, 1997) "Either a Pirate Ship or a Zamboni"*
notes: Summary: Rerun is looking over the lake at the horizon, clouds and seagulls in sky. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Pirate Ships"

150.title: Peanuts
150.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: The pirate ship lands, and Conrad can't see because he's wearing two eyepatches.
Key word: Fame, bonking.

151.title: Peanuts
151.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: The pirates all ordered vanilla.
Key words: Buried treasure, chocolate, strawberry, marble fudge, ice cream, flavors.

152.title: Peanuts
152.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Sally's new philosophy is "No!".
Key words: Negativity, not caring, beanbag chairs, answers.

153.title: Peanuts
153.author: Schulz.
153.series: Aug. 27, 1997) "Later We Became Quite Good Friends"*
notes: Summary: Olaf tells about how he chased a rabbit once.

154.title: Peanuts
154.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy gets a letter from Spike wondering what happened to Andy and Olaf; Mickey Mouse has been by with gifts for them.

155.title: Peanuts
155.author: Schulz.
155.series: Oct. 14, 1997) "We Think Maybe We Took Another Wrong Turn"*
notes: Summary: Olaf and Andy get up the nerve to tell Snoopy they're lost.

156.title: Peanuts
156.author: Schulz.
156.series: Oct. 15, 1997) "Have You Ever Seen the Pyramids by Moonlight?"*
notes: Summary: Andy and Olaf couldn't find the right desert.

157.title: Peanuts
157.author: by Schulz.
157.series: Oct. 16, 1997) "An Experienced Guide to Show Them the Way"*
notes: Summary: Andy and Olaf set off with Woodstock to look for Spike, as Snoopy narrates on his typewriter.

158.title: Peanuts
158.author: Schulz.
158.series: Oct. 17, 1997) "There's Only One Way to Find Out!"*
notes: Summary: Woodstock, Andy and Olaf may have reached the edge of the Earth, if the Earth is flat, but Olaf jumps.

159.title: Peanuts
159.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Patty says the money is in figure skating, and Marcie asks her what book she's reading.

160.title: Peanuts
160.author: by Charles Schulz.
160.series: Feb. 16, 1998) "I Think We Made Another Wrong Turn"*
notes: Summary: Olaf and Andy come upon an igloo.

161.title: Peanuts
161.author: Schulz.
161.series: Feb. 27, 1998) "Make Sure You Wash Your Paws Afterward"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy recalls his early training in shaking hands.

162.title: Peanuts
162.author: Schulz.
162.series: Mar. 19, 1998) "My Mother Didn't Raise Me to Be a Farmer"*
notes: Summary: Rerun is trying to hoe the sidewalk.

163.title: Peanuts
163.author: Schulz.
163.series: May 12, 1998) "You'll Take Her Soft, Cool, Little Hand in Yours"*
notes: Summary: Linus tells Charlie Brown how he'll dance with the little red-haired girl, and Charlie faints.

164.title: Peanuts
164.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy is leading the scouts on a hike, and the last bird has golf clubs instead of a knapsack.

165.title: Peanuts
165.author: Schulz.
165.series: June 9, 1998) "Where Did You Get Your Mom?"*
notes: Summary: Linus wants a dog, but his mom won't let him.

166.title: Peanuts
166.author: Schulz.
166.series: June 18, 1998) "I Don't Know Who Guards the Front"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy explains that the job of a dog is to eat, sleep, and guard the back of the house.

167.title: Peanuts
167.author: Schulz.
167.series: June 20, 1998) "Dogs Can Bark, Birds Can't Bark"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy has to tell Woodstock that "`/`/`/" isn't barking.

168.title: Peanuts
168.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Sally wants to know how Snoopy can scare away burglars while he's eating.

169.title: Peanuts
169.author: by Schulz.
169.series: July 20, 1998) "I Think I've Been Watching Too Much Tumbleweed"*
notes: Summary: Spike's eyes are hurting.

170.title: Peanuts
170.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Spike is sitting with a cactus watching an hourglass.

171.title: Peanuts
171.author: Schulz.
171.series: July 24, 1998) "I'm Usually Free in the Afternoon During the Middle of the Week"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy offers to guard Linus's house in return for being allowed to share the blanket.

172.title: Peanuts
172.author: Schulz.
172.series: July 29, 1998) "In Such and Such Fields the Poppies Blow"*
notes: Summary: Spike and Snoopy are in the trenches in World War I; Spike can't finish his poem because he doesn't know where they are.

173.title: Peanuts
173.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Someone has written a poem a lot like Spike's: "In Flanders Fields the Poppies Blow.."

174.title: Peanuts
174.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tells the teacher that his dog is smart.

175.title: Peanuts
175.author: Schulz.
175.series: Oct. 29, 1998) "Don't Put It In the Bag, I'll Ride It Home"*
notes: Summary: Linus hopes somebody will give him a bicycle while he's trick or treating.

176.title: Peanuts
176.author: Schulz.
176.series: Feb. 18, 1999) "Try Not to Hit Them Into the Lake"*
notes: Summary: Sally gives her grampa some golf balls for his birthday.

177.title: Peanuts
177.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus offers to chase the ball if Snoopy will throw it.

178.title: Peanuts
178.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is leaving for school.

179.title: Peanuts
179.author: Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Golf for a cancer fund, and tennis for a kidney foundation brings up the idea of a benefit baseball tournament.
Original copyright 1973.

180.title: Peanuts
180.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus asks Snoopy the doctor why he seems nervous.

181.title: Peanuts
181.author: by Charles Schulz.
181.series: July 22, 2000) "It Was a Dark and Stormy Marriage"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is writing Gone with the Wind III.

182.title: Peanuts
182.author: Schulz.
182.series: Sept. 22, 2000) "Do It Fifty Times a Day, And You'll Never Have To Have Acupuncture!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy has discovered a new exercise.
Original copyright year 1974.

183.title: Peanuts
183.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Lucy would change the world if she were in charge, she tells Charlie Brown.

184.title: Peanuts
184.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Schroeder orders another piano.

185.title: Peanuts
185.author: Schulz.
185.series: Oct. 7, 2000) "I Threw Schroeder's Piano Down the Sewer, Now it's Just a Matter of Time Until He Loves Me"*
notes: Summary: Lucy removes the competition.

186.title: Peanuts
186.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Woodstock doesn't want to go around the world, he hates traveling.

187.title: Peanuts
187.author: Schulz.
187.series: Nov. 18, 2000) "Yes, Last Week I Had to Play Eighteen Holes with a Range Ball!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy agrees that surgeons are working harder and making less money.

188.title: Peanuts
188.author: by Charles Schulz.
188.series: Apr. 18, 2001) "Don't Say That, I Was Just Getting Comfortable"*
notes: Summary: Lucy has a lawn chair in right field.
Copyright 1989.

189.title: Peanuts
189.author: by Charles Schulz.
189.series: June 13, 2001) "Somehow Chow Tastes Different When You Get A New Mess Sergeant"*
notes: Summary: Dad is feeding Snoopy while Charlie Brown is at summer camp.
Original copyright 1989.

190.title: Peanuts
190.author: Schulz.
190.series: June 7, 2002) "Wouldn't It Have Been Safer Just to Stay on the Sidewalk?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown reads to Sally about cowboys galloping on prairies, and the danger of horses stepping in holes.

191.title: Peanuts
191.author: Charles M
191.series: June 11, 2002) "I'd Better Use War and Peace"*
notes: Summary: Marcy tells Patty to study hard in summer school, and Patty considers hitting her with a small poetry book.

192.title: Peanuts
192.author: by Charles Schultz.
notes: Summary: Linus leaves Snoopy with his blanket and goes to make a chocolate sundae.
Originally copyright 1990.

193.title: Peanuts
193.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy has been to the veterinarian, but he still has one question.
Original copyright 1990.

194.title: Peanuts
194.author: by Charles M
194.series: Aug. 8, 2003) "Maybe Somebody Better Get the Lifeguard"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown tries to impress the little red-haired girl by helping her with her umbrella.

195.title: Peanuts
195.author: Schulz.
195.series: Aug. 9, 2003) "You're the Only Person I Know Who Has Overweight Hands"*
notes: Summary: Lucy looks at Charlie Brown's hands.

196.title: Peanuts
196.author: Schulz.
196.series: Aug. 30, 2003) "That Stupid Beagle is Making Fun of My Education!"*
notes: Summary: Sally misspells the world "aisle," and Snoopy laughs.

197.title: Peanuts
197.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Spike shows the prize, his new lawnmower, sitting in the sand among the cactus plants.
Original copyright 1991.

198.title: Peanuts
198.author: by Charles Schulz.
198.series: Oct. 16, 2003) "So I Wrote to the Contest People, and Told Them I Had no Use for a Lawn Mower"*
notes: Summary: So now Spike has a nice toy sailboat in the desert.
Original copyright 1991.

199.title: Peanuts
199.author: Schulz.
199.series: Apr. 12, 2004) "I Should Have Stayed in Pre-School"*
notes: Copyright 1990.
Summary: Sally doesn't like field trips.

200.title: Peanuts
200.author: Schulz.
200.series: Apr. 12, 2004) "It's Hard to Get Excited About a Bowl of Rain Water"*
notes: Copyright 1970.

201.title: Peanuts
201.author: Schulz.
201.series: Apr. 14, 2004) "All Girls Look Forward to their First Kiss in the Rain"*
notes: Copyright 1970.

202.title: Peanuts
202.author: by Charles Schulz.
202.series: Apr. 14, 2004) "Field Trips are Supposed to be Very Educational"*
notes: Copyright 1990.

203.title: Peanuts
203.author: Schulz.
203.series: July 2, 2004) "Has He Been Rehearsing What He's Going to Say?"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is off to the Daisy Hill Puppy Farm to give a Fourth of July speech.

204.title: Peanuts
204.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: In a silent strip, Snoopy and Linus struggle over the blanket, and Snoopy ends up sitting on Linus and sucking his thumb.

205.title: Peanuts
205.author: Schulz.
205.series: July 3, 2004) "The Introduction is Over, I'm On!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy sits on a folding chair, about to make his Fourth of July speech at the Daisy Hill Puppy Farm, then as he gets to the podium he gets bonked by a supper dish.

206.title: Peanuts
206.author: Schulz.
206.series: July 14, 2005) "I'm the World's Best Lawn Sprinkler Runner-Througher!"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy is disappointed that Lucy won't let him join the fun.
Original copyright 1969.

207.title: Peanuts
207.author: Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: The girls want to warn whomever might marry Charlie Brown.

208.title: Peanuts
208.author: Charles Schulz.
208.series: May 10, 2006) "And She Must Enjoy Sitting Up Until All Hours at Night Listening to Obscure String Quartets"*
notes: Summary: Schroeder lays out his requirements for a wife, which include cooking and a sense of humor.

209.title: Peanuts
209.author: Schulz.
209.series: May 10, 2006) "I Guess We Should Have Come Yesterday"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy and the scouts see the fall of a rock that has been perched on a cliff for ten million years.
Original copyright 1993.

210.title: Peanuts
210.author: Charles M
210.series: May 27, 2006) "What If I Decided to Plant a Garden?"*
notes: Copyright 1993.

211.title: Peanuts
211.author: Charles M
211.series: June 2, 2006) "I Think You Get Better Grades If You're Cute"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty experiments with cuteness.
Copyright 1993.

212.title: Peanuts
212.author: by Charles Schulz.
212.series: Apr. 27, 2007) "Maybe They Think of Barking as Being Work"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown and Linus wonder about dogs not having to do anything.
Copyright 1994.

213.title: Peanuts
213.author: by Charles M
213.series: Sept. 1, 2007) "Permission from their Primary Care Physician, and Their Mom"*
notes: Summary: The world famous surgeon explains the rules.
Original copyright 1994.

214.title: Peanuts
214.author: by Schulz.
notes: Summary: Linus stops the rain as if by magic, and worries that people will think he's a demon.
Original copyright 1960.

215.title: Peanuts
215.author: Schulz.
215.series: July 25, 2009) "When Spike Saw His Mom, He Immediately Felt Better"*
notes: Summary: Mom brought tapioca pudding.
Original copyright 1996.

216.title: Peanuts
216.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: A girl named 3 introduces herself and her sister named 4.

217.title: Peanuts
